p:
Various metabolic activities lead to the generation of reactive oxygen species (ROS) as well as non radical molecules such as O 2, H 2O 2, and OH− . They can play vital roles in the body, such as induction of programmed cell death and tolerance to various environmental stresses. The excessive production of ROS is harmful for the body and known to cause oxidative stress
27 . The most commonly used methods to find out the antioxidant potential of any compound are DPPH and ABTS free radical scavenging activity. The antioxidant compounds help to prevent cancer, aging, and neurodegenerative processes
28 . In this study, the chloroformic fungal extract showed 30.59–89% and 20.6–90.5% scavenging potential for DPPH and ABTS, respectively. This is in consonance with the earlier observations made by Uzma and Chowdappa
8 on various endophytic fungi. Phenolics and flavonoids act as primary and secondary antioxidants and help in reducing the lipid peroxidation
29 . The chloroformic extract showed a higher phenolic than the flavonoid content, which might be responsible for good scavenging and reducing power of the extract
30 .
